body_html:
I checked out pytorch again and also made a whole new Anaconda installation (in the previous environment there were 5 different libcaffe2.so by now). libcaffe2.so can indeed be found in ./lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/lib/libcaffe2.so.

I followed the default build instructions instructions to the word. When running from caffe2.python import workspace now I get past the previous error, but (after clearing up more issues with conda install -c anaconda protobuf and pip install future) now get:

/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/caffe2/python/workspace.py in <module>()
     47     NumCudaDevices = C.num_cuda_devices
     48     GetCUDAVersion = C.get_cuda_version
---> 49     GetCuDNNVersion = C.get_cudnn_version
     50 
     51     def GetCudaPeerAccessPattern():

'module' object has no attribute 'get_cudnn_version'

Let me know if this should be a new issue.

body:
I checked out pytorch again and also made a whole new Anaconda installation (in the previous environment there were 5 different `libcaffe2.so` by now). `libcaffe2.so` can indeed be found in `./lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/lib/libcaffe2.so`. 

I followed the [default build instructions](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch#from-source) instructions to the word. When running `from caffe2.python import workspace` now I get past the previous error, but (after clearing up more issues with `conda install -c anaconda protobuf ` and `pip install future`) now get: 

```
/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/caffe2/python/workspace.py in <module>()
     47     NumCudaDevices = C.num_cuda_devices
     48     GetCUDAVersion = C.get_cuda_version
---> 49     GetCuDNNVersion = C.get_cudnn_version
     50 
     51     def GetCudaPeerAccessPattern():

'module' object has no attribute 'get_cudnn_version'
```

 Let me know if this should be a new issue.
